prompt: <description>Part 1: 3D Model of a Rectangular Prism with a Curved Top Edge Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with zero rotation and translation. This will serve as the origin for our sketch. Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch Now, create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system, and follow these steps to create the required loops: Loop 1 on Face 1 1. Start at the point (0, 0.25) and draw a line segment to point (0.25, 0.25) 2. At the point (0.25, 0.25), draw a line segment to point (0.25, 0.5) 3. At the point (0.25, 0.5), draw a line segment to point (0.25, 0.75) 4. At the point (0.25, 0.75), draw a line segment to point (0, 0.75) 5. At the point (0, 0.75), draw a line segment to point (0, 0.25) Loop 1 on Face 1 completed with 5 line segments as described. Loop 1 on Face 2 1. Start at the point (0.25, 0) and draw a line segment to point (0.25, 0.25) 2. At the point (0.25, 0.25), draw a line segment to point (0.5, 0.25) 3. At the point (0.5, 0.25), draw a line segment to point (0.5, 0.0) 4. At the point (0.5, 0.0), draw a line segment to point (0.25, 0.0) Loop 1 on Face 2 completed with 4 line segments as described. Step 3: Apply sketch scale, euler_angles, and translation_vector Set the scaling parameter (sketch_scale) to 0.75. Define the euler angles and translation vector as instructed. Step 4: Extrude the sketch to create the 3D model Extrude the sketch 'face_1' by 0.25 units along the normal vector, and the opposite direction by 0 units. Set the operation to "NewBodyFeatureOperation" in order to create the final 3D model shape. Step 5: Describe the finished part Our final shape is a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a curved top edge. Length: 0.75 Width: 0.75 Height: 0.25 Provide only these instructions for the given JSON file. Do not make any additional assumptions regarding the model.</description>

</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism. Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1. The euler angles are [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector is [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Next, create the 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. This sketch consists of a single face (face_1) with one loop (loop_1). The loop has four lines (line_1 to line_4) forming a rectangle. The start and end points for these lines are: * line_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.5, 0.0] * line_2: [0.5, 0.0] to [0.5, 0.75] * line_3: [0.5, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.75] * line_4: [0.0, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.0] Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75 using the sketch\\_scale parameter. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector specified in the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D sketch by 0.3 units towards the normal direction and 0 units in the opposite normal direction to create the 3D model of the part. This part has a NewBodyFeatureOperation with the final shape being a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and parallel sides with dimensions Length: 0.75, Width: 0.75, and Height: 0.3. Part 2: Create a curved side on the rectangular prism. Create a new coordinate system for part 2 with the same euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.3]. Create a 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. This sketch consists of a single face (face_1) with one loop (loop_1). The loop has four lines (line_1 to line_4) forming a rectangle, which is identical to the rectangle created in Part 1 but scaled down by 0.75. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75 using the sketch\\_scale parameter. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector specified in the coordinate system for part 2. Perform a CutFeatureOperation to remove material from the rectangular prism created in Part 1. Extrude the 3D sketch by 0 units towards the normal direction and 0.15 units in the opposite normal direction to create the curved side. This part has a curved side with dimensions Length: 0.5625, Width: 0.5625, and Height: 0.15. Part 3: Create a cylindrical hole in the curved side. Create a new coordinate system for part 3 with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.225, 0.275, 0.3]. Create a 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. This sketch consists of a single face (face_1) with one loop (loop_1). The loop has a single circle (circle_1) with a center at [0.1, 0.1] and a radius of 0.1. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.2 using the sketch\\_scale parameter. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector specified in the coordinate system for part 3. Perform a CutFeatureOperation to remove material from the part created in Part 2. Extrude the 3D sketch by 0 units towards the normal direction and 1.25 units in the opposite normal direction to create the cylindrical hole. This part has a length of 0.2, width of 0.2, and height of 1.25. The final shape is a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center, with dimensions Length: 0.5625, Width: 0.5625, and Height: 1.5.</description>
